subject: Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: ... The rule:  use plain Ing for all participle endings with sounds It+Ing and Eat+Ing Is in the QM and is uncontroversial I think. The rule: use plain Ing
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "paulhtremblay" <phthenry@...>
wrote:
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Anthony Grahn" <othermale@>
> wrote:
> >
>
> >
> > Yes, they would; some words will look "funny". And in some, the only
> > vowel will be the letter Roe. But this is not unprecedented. The
> > recent proposal for Ing would have "sing" as See+Ing.
>
> I agree with the rest of your email, so I don't want to comment on
> that, but I did want to get clarification on this point. I thought
> that you in fact had suggested that words like "sing" be spelled Sis +
> Inkling. But in an earlier email, you seemed to think I should only
> change TO "ing" into Sis + Inkling if the "ing" was an ending.
> Actually, I got contradictory messages; the first seem to indicate for
> all words, but then you suggested check for roots. I think the
> confusion resulted because we were talking about "ed" endings as well.
>
> I can easily regenerate the CMU dictionary and changed any combination
> that would result in QS "Ng" QS "iN" and QS "IN" to plain N. It makes
> sense to me.
>
> On the same vein, I can also regenerate the dictionary to change what
> would result in QS "ar" into just "r," and then we can actually have a
> test case in the news and see how your proposal works. Of course, I'll
> have to make sure the "ar" is within the same syllable, but I think
> the CMU dictionary uses numbers after the mark off syllables. I
> ignored these numbers before, but they may be useful now.
>

The rule: "use plain Ing for all participle endings with sounds
It+Ing and Eat+Ing"
Is in the QM and is uncontroversial I think.


The rule: "use plain Ing for all cases everywhere of It+Ing and Eat+Ing"
Is a proposal. It directly contradicts the QM but I too think it is
worth considering as it seems to solve a few problems.

Similarly the rule: "use plain Ing for Ing+Gay" Is a proposal not seen
in the QM.

The rule about Day for past tense endings is also in the QM. I don't
recall anyone suggesting a change of it.


I will not say I am 100% convinced by any changes to the QM even the
ones I have suggested. But I do believe they are worth talking about.
And since you have made such an imminently valuable testing tool with
that news feed, we have the advantage of testing any of these ideas
out and seeing if they solve genuine large problems or if they just
introduce more. It is an enormous benefit that by testing on the news
feed we can now avoid talking forever in circles about these things
and actually see if they make sense.
